# Version History - Quick Reference

This document provides a quick overview of what changed in each version of the Acutrack Design System.

## üöÄ Latest Version: 1.0.95

**Release Date**: 2026-02-28  
**Status**: ‚úÖ Ready  
**Improvements**: **Accordion** ‚Äî New theme tokens `border-divider` / `dark-border-divider`; default variant divider visible in light mode; dark and light mode variants enhanced with DS colors (distinct containers and headers); Default vs Filled clearly distinguished (default = lightest + left accent, filled = heavier + full border + stronger header); default left border in light `brand-navy/75`. **Accordion test page** ‚Äî Samples without Card; new "Variants on card background" section with Card. **DatePicker / DateRangePicker** ‚Äî `calendarNavigation` default changed from `'dropdown'` to `'modern'`. Docs: DATEPICKER_COMPONENT_GUIDE, CHANGELOG, VERSION_HISTORY, README, ACUTRACK_DS_QUICK_REFERENCE v1.0.95.  
**Bug Fixes**: None  
**Components Updated**: Accordion, DatePicker, DateRangePicker; tailwind.config.js (border-divider tokens)  
**Dependencies Added**: None

---

## üöÄ Version: 1.0.94

**Release Date**: 2026-02-28  
**Status**: ‚úÖ Ready  
**Improvements**: **Z-index scale** ‚Äî Shared scale in `src/constants/zIndex.ts` (base 1, sticky 40, modal 50, sidebar 59/60, toast 9998, overlay 9999); exported as `Z_INDEX` and Tailwind class constants. **Overlay consistency** ‚Äî Dropdown, MultiSelect, Header user menu use overlay layer (9999); Select inherits from Dropdown. **Sticky** ‚Äî Layout, Footer, Header, DashboardPage sticky use z-40 so modal (50) sits above. Docs: ACUTRACK_DS_QUICK_REFERENCE (Z-Index Scale section), MULTISELECT_COMPONENT_GUIDE, AUTOCOMPLETE_COMPONENT_GUIDE, MODAL_COMPONENT_USAGE_GUIDE; CHANGELOG, VERSION_HISTORY, README v1.0.94.  
**Bug Fixes**: None  
**Components Updated**: Dropdown, MultiSelect, Header, Layout, Footer, index.css  
**Dependencies Added**: None

---

## üöÄ Version: 1.0.93

**Release Date**: 2026-02-26  
**Status**: ‚úÖ Ready  
**Improvements**: **Theme** ‚Äî First visit = light mode; thereafter use stored user preference (localStorage). ThemeToggle, App sidebar toggle, and Sidebar.ThemeToggle no longer use system preference (`prefers-color-scheme`) on first load. **Button** ‚Äî Single-element children (e.g. Avatar, Icon) no longer wrapped in truncating span so they display fully; when `customWidth` is set, button uses `overflow-visible` so circular avatars and similar content are not clipped. Docs: THEME_TOGGLE_DOCUMENTATION, SIDEBAR_COMPONENT_USAGE_GUIDE, ButtonDocumentation, ACUTRACK_DS_QUICK_REFERENCE, CHANGELOG, VERSION_HISTORY, README v1.0.93.  
**Bug Fixes**: None  
**Components Updated**: ThemeToggle, Sidebar (SidebarThemeToggle), Button  
**Dependencies Added**: None

---

## üöÄ Version: 1.0.92

**Release Date**: 2026-02-25 (unreleased)  
**Status**: üöß In progress  
**Improvements**: Table ‚Äî horizontal scroll by default (`allowHorizontalScroll={true}`); table fills container width and shows horizontal scrollbar when content is wider (no cell smushing); scroll container uses `min-w-0` so scrollbar works in flex/grid/cards; table uses `w-full min-w-max` (full width when content fits, overflow when wider). Set `allowHorizontalScroll={false}` for fixed layout. Select, Dropdown, MultiSelect ‚Äî full keyboard list navigation (Arrow Up/Down, Enter, Home/End) with focus on trigger; Tab/Shift+Tab close list and move focus; Escape closes and returns focus; Arrow/list keys no longer scroll the page; keyboard-highlighted option uses same style as hover; Dropdown.Item `isHighlighted` prop; semantic option colors (success/warning/error/info) apply to keyboard highlight. **Focus ring** ‚Äî single brand color (brand-orange / dark-brand-orange) for all components; Input, Textarea, Slider, NumberInput, Button, Link, Checkbox, ToggleSwitch, Select, MultiSelect, SearchBar, Dropdown, Popover, and others now use the same focus ring color; `color` prop on form controls affects border/focus border only, not the ring. Docs: TABLE_DOCUMENTATION; DropdownComponentsDocumentation; MULTISELECT_COMPONENT_GUIDE; INPUT_COMPONENTS_USAGE_GUIDE; ACUTRACK_DS_QUICK_REFERENCE; CHANGELOG, VERSION_HISTORY v1.0.92.

**Components Updated**: Table, Select, Dropdown, MultiSelect  
**Dependencies Added**: None

## üÜï Version 1.0.94 - Z-index scale and overlay consistency

### ‚ú® Improvements

#### Z-index scale and overlay consistency

- **Shared z-index scale**: New **`src/constants/zIndex.ts`** defines a single scale: base (1), sticky (40), modal (50), sidebarBackdrop (59), sidebar (60), toast (9998), overlay (9999). Package exports **`Z_INDEX`** and Tailwind class constants (**`Z_INDEX_OVERLAY_CLASS`**, **`Z_INDEX_TOAST_CLASS`**, **`Z_INDEX_MODAL_CLASS`**, **`Z_INDEX_SIDEBAR_CLASS`**, **`Z_INDEX_SIDEBAR_BACKDROP_CLASS`**, **`Z_INDEX_STICKY_CLASS`**) for apps and custom overlays.
- **Overlay layer (9999)**: Dropdown content, MultiSelect dropdown, and Header user menu popover updated from z-50 to z-[9999]. Select, Popover, Autocomplete, Tooltip, Drawer, and date pickers use the overlay layer consistently.
- **Sticky layer (40)**: Layout, Footer, Header (sticky), and DashboardPage example header use z-40 so modal (50) sits above sticky content.

### üìö Documentation

- **ACUTRACK_DS_QUICK_REFERENCE**: New "Z-Index Scale" section; form components with overlays and custom overlay guidance.
- **MULTISELECT_COMPONENT_GUIDE**, **AUTOCOMPLETE_COMPONENT_GUIDE**, **MODAL_COMPONENT_USAGE_GUIDE**: Z-index references updated to the shared scale.
- **CHANGELOG / VERSION_HISTORY / README**: v1.0.94 entries.

---

## üÜï Version 1.0.93 - Theme first-visit = light; Button Avatar/single-element display

### ‚ú® Improvements

#### Theme: first visit = light, then stored preference

- **ThemeToggle, App, Sidebar.ThemeToggle**: Initial theme no longer uses system preference (`prefers-color-scheme`) on first visit. **First visit** uses **light** mode; **subsequent visits** use the user‚Äôs stored preference from `localStorage` (`theme` key).
- **ThemeToggle**: On mount, reads `localStorage.getItem('theme')`; if missing or invalid, sets theme to `'light'`.
- **Sidebar built-in theme toggle (SidebarThemeToggle)**: Same logic ‚Äî first visit = light, then stored preference; applies theme to document and dispatches `themeChanged` for other components.

#### Button: Avatar and single-element children display fully with customWidth

- **Single-element children**: When `children` is a single React element (e.g. `<Avatar />`, `<Icon />`), the Button no longer wraps it in the truncating span (`min-w-0 truncate`). It uses a non-truncating wrapper (`flex items-center justify-center shrink-0`) so the element is not clipped.
- **customWidth + overflow**: When `customWidth` is set, the button gets `overflow-visible` so content slightly larger than the button (e.g. 32px Avatar in a 40px-wide button) is not clipped ‚Äî circular avatars display as full circles.
- **Use case**: Buttons used as avatar triggers (e.g. `<Button customWidth="40px" variant="ghost"><Avatar size="sm" /></Button>`) now display the avatar correctly.

### üìö Documentation

- **THEME_TOGGLE_DOCUMENTATION**: Initial theme behavior updated to ‚Äúfirst visit = light, then stored preference‚Äù; priority order and initialization flow updated.
- **SIDEBAR_COMPONENT_USAGE_GUIDE**: Theme Toggle section notes built-in toggle uses first visit = light, then stored preference.
- **ButtonDocumentation**: Note on `customWidth` and single-element children (Avatar); overflow-visible when customWidth is set.
- **ACUTRACK_DS_QUICK_REFERENCE**: v1.0.93 theme and Button entries.
- **CHANGELOG / VERSION_HISTORY / README**: v1.0.93 entries.

---

## üÜï Version 1.0.92 - Table horizontal scroll; Select/Dropdown/MultiSelect keyboard & highlight

### ‚ú® Improvements

#### Table: horizontal scroll by default, full width in cards

- **allowHorizontalScroll**: New prop on `Table.Root` (default `true`). When true, the table fills the full width of its container (e.g. card) and shows a horizontal scrollbar when content is wider than the container instead of smushing cells. Set `allowHorizontalScroll={false}` for fixed layout (columns fit to container; first row defines column widths).
- **Scroll container**: When `allowHorizontalScroll` is true, the table root applies `min-w-0` so the scroll container stays bounded by its parent in flex/grid/cards; the horizontal scrollbar appears correctly (aligned with VirtualizedTable).
- **Table width**: With horizontal scroll enabled, the table uses `w-full min-w-max` ‚Äî full width when content fits, overflow with scroll when content is wider.
- **Layout**: When `allowHorizontalScroll` is true, the table uses auto layout; when false, `tableLayout="fixed"` as before.

#### Select, Dropdown, MultiSelect: keyboard navigation, focus, and highlight

- **Keyboard list navigation**: Arrow Up/Down move highlighted option; Enter selects (or toggles in MultiSelect); Home/End jump to first/last. Focus stays on trigger so typing works in typeable Select and searchable MultiSelect.
- **Tab / Shift+Tab**: Close list and move focus; Escape closes and returns focus to trigger.
- **No page scroll**: Arrow and list keys call `preventDefault()` at Trigger and Content so the document does not scroll when the list is open.
- **Keyboard highlight**: Option under keyboard focus uses same background as hover; **Dropdown.Item** supports **`isHighlighted`** for listbox options.
- **Semantic colors**: Options with success/warning/error/info show the same colored background and text when keyboard-highlighted as on hover.

#### Focus ring: single brand color across components

- **Unified focus ring**: All components use the same focus ring color: **brand-orange** (light) and **dark-brand-orange** (dark) for a consistent, recognizable focus indicator.
- **Form controls**: Input, Textarea, NumberInput, Slider, SearchBar ‚Äî the `color` prop controls border and focus border only; the focus ring is always brand-orange when `hasFocusRing` is true.
- **Buttons, links, toggles**: Button (all variants), Link, Checkbox, ToggleSwitch (all colors), and other interactive components use the same brand focus ring.

#### Documentation

- **TABLE_DOCUMENTATION**: "Horizontal scrolling and parent container"; props and examples for `allowHorizontalScroll`.
- **DropdownComponentsDocumentation**: Select accessibility (keyboard list nav, focus on trigger, Tab/Escape, highlight).
- **MULTISELECT_COMPONENT_GUIDE**: Keyboard navigation section (Arrow/Enter/Home/End, Tab/Escape, highlight and semantic colors).
- **INPUT_COMPONENTS_USAGE_GUIDE**: Select/MultiSelect keyboard notes.
- **ACUTRACK_DS_QUICK_REFERENCE**: v1.0.92 dropdown/select keyboard and highlight; focus ring standardization.
- **INPUT_COMPONENTS_USAGE_GUIDE**: Focus ring color note (single brand color).
- **CHANGELOG / VERSION_HISTORY**: v1.0.92 entries.

---

## üÜï Version 1.0.91 - Dark Mode Colors, Button Grey-Primary, Table Scrollbar

### ‚ú® Improvements

#### Dark mode: color alignment and scrollbars

- **Scrollbar colors**: Dark mode scrollbar colors now match the current dark theme. Firefox `scrollbar-color` and Webkit track/thumb use `dark-bg-primary` (#13161d) and `dark-bg-tertiary` (#1d2227). Applied to `.custom-scrollbar` and `.ds-scrollbar-global` in `src/index.css` and ScrollbarSection docs.
- **Button grey-primary (dark mode)**: Base uses `dark:!bg-dark-grey-primary` and `dark:!text-grey-900`; hover uses `dark:hover:!bg-dark-grey-primary-hover` and `dark:hover:!text-grey-900`; disabled uses `dark:disabled:!bg-dark-grey-primary/70` and `dark:disabled:!text-grey-900/50` so the correct light background and muted disabled state apply.
- **Button disabled opacity**: Dark mode disabled buttons use `dark:disabled:opacity-60` (was 20%) for better visibility.

#### Table

- **Scrollable body**: When `Table.Body` has `isScrollable={true}`, it now includes `custom-scrollbar` so vertical scroll uses the design system scrollbar (and updated dark mode colors). The table wrapper already used `custom-scrollbar` for horizontal scroll.
- **Custom header height**: `Table.Header` has a new optional prop **`headerHeight`** ‚Äî pass a number (px) or string (e.g. `'48px'`, `'3rem'`) to set a custom header row height; applied as `height` and `minHeight` on the `<thead>`.

#### Documentation

- **CHANGELOG / VERSION_HISTORY**: v1.0.91 entries.
- **TABLE_DOCUMENTATION**: Scrollable body uses `custom-scrollbar`; `Table.Header` documents `headerHeight` (v1.0.91).
- **ACUTRACK_DS_USAGE_GUIDE**: Table added to components with styled scrollbars.

---

## üÜï Version 1.0.90 - Stepper: Connectors, Alignment, completedIcon, Opacity, Vertical Fix

### ‚ú® Improvements

#### Stepper

- **No-gap connectors**: Horizontal connector lines meet step circles with no gap (flex layout; connector uses flex-1).
- **Content alignment**: Horizontal steps ‚Äî title/description left-aligned under the circle.
- **completedIcon**: New `Stepper.Step` prop to override the completed-state icon (default `"check"`); e.g. `completedIcon="check_circle"`.
- **Connector color**: Connector after a step is colored only when that step is **completed**, not when it is the current (active) step.
- **Future steps opacity**: Incomplete (future) steps use 60% opacity; transition-opacity for status changes.
- **Vertical variant**: Indicator column no longer full-width; text sits to the right of circle with correct wrapping and alignment.

#### SearchBar

- **showSuggestionsList**: Single prop to control when the suggestions dropdown is shown; when `false`, the dropdown is never shown. Use e.g. `showSuggestionsList={value.trim().length >= 2}` for address-style.
- **Removed minCharsToShowSuggestions**: Replaced by passing a boolean to `showSuggestionsList`.
- **Docs**: SEARCHBAR_README updated with examples and API table.

#### Accordion

- **Primary variant**: When `color === 'primary'`, default variant has no border; other colors get a border when `isBordered` is true.
- **Variants**: `default`, `minimal`, `bordered`, `outlined`, `elevated`, `filled` with distinct container and header styles.
- **Content spacing**: Content block below divider uses `pt-4` for spacing between header and body.

#### Documentation

- **PROGRESS_INDICATORS_GUIDE**: Stepper section ‚Äî Color and Variant, Custom completed icon, Behavior (v1.0.90), and full Props tables (root: color, variant; Step: completedIcon).
- **README**: v1.0.90 section includes Stepper, SearchBar, and Accordion.

---

## üÜï Version 1.0.89 - Input Dark Mode Color + SearchBar showSuggestionsList + PasswordInput onBlur

### ‚ú® Improvements

#### Input: Color prop and error state in dark mode

- **Color prop**: The `color` prop now correctly shows the border in both light and dark mode. Each color in `colorClasses` includes a `border` width class; dark mode uses `dark:border-*` and `dark:focus:border-*`. Focus ring uses matching `dark:focus:ring-*`.
- **Error / success / warning**: Full dark mode styling for these states; state styling takes precedence over the `color` prop.
- **Docs**: INPUT_COMPONENTS_USAGE_GUIDE ‚Äî "Color and theme behavior" and "Avoiding the browser 'Please fill out this field' popup" (use `noValidate` on the form for custom-only validation).

#### SearchBar: showSuggestionsList only

- **showSuggestionsList**: Single prop to control when the suggestions dropdown is shown. When `false`, the dropdown is never shown. Use e.g. `showSuggestionsList={value.trim().length >= 2}` for address-style.
- **Removed minCharsToShowSuggestions**: Replaced by deriving the boolean in the app and passing to `showSuggestionsList`.
- **Docs**: SEARCHBAR_README updated; address-style pattern documented.

#### PasswordInput: onBlur prop

- **onBlur**: Optional `onBlur?: (e: React.FocusEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => void` for blur validation and real-time validation flows.

---

## üÜï Version 1.0.88 - Sidebar Mobile Default + Breakpoint Fix + useMediaQuery Enhancement

### ‚ú® Improvements

#### Sidebar: Hide on Mobile by Default

The Sidebar now **hides on mobile by default** (`hideOnMobile` defaults to `true`). This provides a cleaner mobile experience where the sidebar is off-screen until opened via the hamburger button.

**Breaking Change:**
- **Before**: `hideOnMobile` defaulted to `false` (sidebar visible but collapsed on mobile)
- **After**: `hideOnMobile` defaults to `true` (sidebar hidden on mobile, overlay when opened)

**Migration:**
- To show the sidebar on mobile (old behavior), explicitly set `hideOnMobile={false}`
- To use the overlay pattern (new default), pass `mobileOpen` and `onMobileOpenChange` props

#### Sidebar: Mobile Breakpoint Adjusted (767px)

The mobile breakpoint changed from `768px` to `767px` so that tablets like iPad Mini (768px width) show the sidebar instead of hiding it.

- **Before**: Mobile = `(max-width: 768px)` (iPad Mini 768px was treated as mobile)
- **After**: Mobile = `(max-width: 767px)` (iPad Mini 768px shows sidebar)

#### useMediaQuery: Enhanced DevTools Emulator Support

The `useMediaQuery` hook now better detects viewport changes in Chrome DevTools device emulator:

**New Features:**
- **Visual Viewport API**: Listens to `window.visualViewport` `resize` and `scroll` events
- **Orientation Change**: Listens to `window.orientationchange` events
- **Development Polling**: In development mode, re-checks media queries every 800ms to catch emulator dropdown changes that don't fire events

This ensures layout adapts immediately when selecting devices (e.g., iPhone 12) in the emulator without requiring manual resize or orientation toggle.

---

### Input & Form Components: Disabled State, Floating Label, Ghost, Primary/Secondary

#### Input: Stronger Disabled State (All Variants + Dark Mode)

- **Disabled styling**: Same distinct look for all variants when disabled: gray background (`bg-gray-100` / `dark:bg-gray-900`), muted border (`border-gray-300` / `dark:border-gray-700`), dimmed text and placeholder. Label, helper text, and left/right icons use reduced opacity (label/helper: 70%; icons: 60%; placeholder: 70%).
- **Dark mode**: Disabled inputs use darker background, dimmer text, and `dark:opacity-85` on the container so they clearly recede on dark UIs.
- **Cursor**: Container and input use `cursor-not-allowed` when disabled.

#### Input & Form Components: `labelMode` ('top' | 'floating')

- **Input, Textarea, PasswordInput, Select, NumberInput, MultiSelect** support `labelMode?: 'top' | 'floating'` (default `'top'`).
- **`labelMode="floating"`**: Label sits inside the field and floats up on focus or when the field has a value. Aligns with DatePicker `labelMode`. When floated, the label uses `bg-bg-primary` and `px-1` so it sits cleanly above the border.

#### Input (and similar): Ghost Variant Clarification

- **Ghost variant**: Uses transparent border by default; border appears on hover and focus so ghost is visually distinct from primary (white background).

#### Form Components: Primary vs Secondary Background Swap

- **Primary**: Now uses white background (`bg-bg-secondary`).  
- **Secondary**: Now uses light blue/tertiary (`bg-bg-tertiary`).  
- Applied to: Input, Select, Checkbox, Textarea, NumberInput, PasswordInput, MultiSelect, Slider.

#### Input: Number Input Border

- **CSS**: `.acutrack-input[type="number"]` now has `border-style: solid` and optional spinner hiding so number inputs show the same border as text inputs across browsers.

---

## üÜï Version 1.0.87 - Table Striped Rows + Drawer Refactor + Fixes

### ‚ú® Improvements

#### Table & VirtualizedTable: Striped Rows (2nd, 4th, 6th...)

Striped rows now apply to the **2nd, 4th, 6th...** data rows. The **first data row** uses the base background.

- **Table**: `even:bg-bg-tertiary/50` (was `odd:`)
- **VirtualizedTable**: `(startIndex + index) % 2 === 1` for stripes on 2nd, 4th, 6th...

#### Drawer: Comprehensive Refactor with Industry-Standard Libraries

The Drawer component has been completely refactored to use battle-tested libraries, fixing critical accessibility and UX issues:

**New Dependencies:**
- `framer-motion` - Smooth, reliable animations
- `focus-trap-react` - Robust focus management
- `react-remove-scroll` - Scroll locking without layout shifts

**Key Improvements:**
- ‚úÖ **Eliminated Layout Shifts**: `react-remove-scroll` correctly disables body scroll without altering `position` or causing content reflow
- ‚úÖ **Fixed Focus Management**: `focus-trap-react` reliably traps focus within the drawer and handles all edge cases
- ‚úÖ **Simplified Logic**: Removed complex `useState` flags and `setTimeout` race conditions, replaced with declarative `AnimatePresence`
- ‚úÖ **Preserved Scroll Position**: No more `body.style` manipulation, page scroll position naturally preserved
- ‚úÖ **Fully Backward Compatible**: All props and API remain unchanged

**Technical Changes:**
- Replaced manual DOM manipulation with `framer-motion` animations
- Replaced custom focus trap implementation with `focus-trap-react`
- Replaced `body.style.overflow` manipulation with `react-remove-scroll`
- Simplified animation logic using `AnimatePresence` and motion variants
- Improved focus restoration when drawer closes

### üêõ Bug Fixes

#### DashboardTestPage: `t()` Return Type (TypeScript)

`t()` helper now returns `string` via `getTranslation(...) ?? fallback`, fixing `string | null` errors for Header.Search, UserMenu links, VirtualizedTable columns, and labelMap.

#### FileUploaderTestPage: Validation Errors Display (TypeScript)

Fixed TypeScript errors in validation error display:
- Changed `description` prop from JSX to string
- Moved error list to `children` prop
- Updated to use correct `FileValidationError` properties: `error.file.name` and `error.errors.join(', ')`

#### Drawer: Panel No Longer Overrides Custom Position/Size

The panel's base classes no longer include hardcoded position or size. `position`, `size`, `className`, and `style` work as documented. **Contributor:** William Stovall (98576bc)

#### Sidebar: Safelist `translate-x-0` and `-translate-x-full` for Mobile Overlay

`translate-x-0` and `-translate-x-full` are used dynamically for the Sidebar mobile overlay slide-in/out. They were added to the Tailwind `safelist` so they are not purged from built CSS when `hideOnMobile` and the mobile overlay are used.

---

## üÜï Version 1.0.86 - Language Selector Enhancements + Fix

### ‚ú® New Features

#### Gender & Plural Translation Support
Enhanced `getTranslation()` helper to support gendered and pluralized translations for proper internationalization.
